basics.name: Michael Jake Sumaylo
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I was studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I graduated in Spring 2024.

work.company: UH Manoa Hamilton Library - Hawaii-Pacific Collection
work.summary: Circulation staff for closed collection, responsible for pulling books for patrons and other related duties.
highlights: Handling rare material requested by patrons
Assisted circulation staff manager in reorganizing and documenting available Pacific newspapers to database

volunteer.summary: Tracking finances for TORCH, and supporting affliated technology outreach education.
Updating the club website, and aiding fellow officers in club events.
Mentoring introductory web dev to 6th-12th grader students on Oahu.

awards.title: Manoa Opportunity Grant
awards.summary: Offered to students based on financial need and availability. This fund is prorated according to enrollment. Minimum enrollment is half time. Graduate students enrolled in a 1 credit full-time course will not be considered for this grant.

awards.title: Hawaii State Science Fair
awards.summary: Researched the effects of Fresnel lenses and light approaching from different angles on the power output of a solar panel
